systemPipeShiny 0.99.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

addData() getData()

Add and get data between shiny modules

clearableTextInput()

A clearable text inputInput UI

dynamicFile()

dynamically generate select file input

dynamicFileServer()

Server side function for dynamicFile

emptyIsFalse()

empty things and FALSE will return FALSE

exploreDSS()

exploreDSS Convenience wrapper function to transform raw read counts using the DESeq2 package transformations methods. The input file has to contain all the genes, not just differentially expressed ones.

gallery()

A shiny gallery component

genGallery()

generate gallery by only providing tab names

genHrefTable()

generate a table that lists of hyper reference buttons by rows

hexLogo() hexPanel()

Hexagon logo and logo panel

genHrefTab() hrefTab()

Show a list of tabs in buttons

hrefTable()

A table of lists of hyper reference buttons

loadDF()

Load tabular files as tibbles to server

makePlotData()

Create data receive methods for plot tabs

makePrepro()

Create data tab preprocess methods

msg() spsinfo() spswarn() spserror()

SPS terminal message logging methods

newTabPlot() newTabData()

Create a new SPS Tab

pgPaneUpdate() pgPaneUI()

A draggable progress panel

plotContainer

SPS snapshots container

plotExploreDSS()

plotExploreDSS Scatterplot of transformed counts from two samples

quiet()

suppress cat print output

removeSpsTab()

Remove a SPS tab

renderDesc()

Render some collapsible description

shinyCatch()

Catch error, warning, message text

shinyCheckPkg()

check name space in server

sps()

SystemPipeShiny app start function

spsDb

SPS database functions

spsEncryption

SPS encryption functions

spsHr()

hr line with color #3b8dbc38

spsInit()

Create a SystemPipeShiny project

spsOption()

Get or set SPS options

spsValidate()

Validate expressions

tabTitle()

h2 title with bootstrap info color

textInputGroup()

Text input with a button right next to

useSps()

Use SystemPipeShiny javascripts and css style call it in your head section

viewSpsDefaults()

Print systemPipeShiny default Options
